full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 755 Filed 08/10/22 Page 260 of 262 1971 LC8VMAX8
1 THE COURT: I guess the question is so you presumably need resolution before the close of the government's case.
2 MR. ROHRBACH: Yes, your Honor.
3 THE COURT: That could be -- it could be tomorrow, but I suppose -- well, if you want resolution tomorrow, following briefing by both sides, then you'll be mindful of the Court's schedule.
4 MR. ROHRBACH: Yes, your Honor.
5 THE COURT: And I would need briefing completed, I think, by 10 p.m. tonight.
6 Now, if I have till Friday to resolve it, if I have till Friday to resolve it, then you can have till midnight, I suppose. But I gather we don't know whether we'll have the jury here on Friday or not.
7 MR. ROHRBACH: Since we don't know, the government would prefer to brief it tonight. We could propose doing simultaneous briefing at 10 p.m.
8 THE COURT: No, no, no. I don't think that makes sense, because I don't know what new argument the government is going to make and neither does the defense.
9 MR. ROHRBACH: That makes sense.
10 THE COURT: So I'll say 7 for the government, 10 for the defense.
11 MR. PAGLIUCA: That's fine, your Honor.
12 And it may be quick on our side, since it seems to me SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00019122
